monogr.title: Divine considerations of the soule : concerning the excellencie of God, and the vilenesse of man. Verie necessarie and profitable for euerie true Christian seriously looke into. By N.B. G
monogr.author: Breton, Nicholas

div.head: To the Reader.
div.p:
MAnye reade they knowe not what, too many they care not what, but how necessarie is it for all men before they reade, to consider what they reade, and to what end they bestowe both time & labour in that excercise, I refer to the iudgement of their discretions, who are able to finde the difference betwixt good & euill: you then that reade this little worke to your greate good, if you well disgest the considerations contained in the same, Let mee intreate you what you finde for your good, to esteem of as you haue cause,
and what may be to your dislike to correct in your kinde patience; in a little room is matter enough for the good consideration of a cōtemplatiue sperit, which looking towards heauen, and longing to bee there, shall finde such comfort in these considerations, as I hope shal giue cause to gloriefie God the Author of all good, and not thinke a misse of me, that by his goodnes haue set them downe for the good of all his Seruants: of which number, not doubting you to be one, I leaue you in this and all your good labours, to his onely gratious blessing.

closer.signed: Your well wishing friend, N. B
